intro: Silphium wasiotense, commonly known as the narrow-leaved silphium, is a rare and ancient plant native to the Mediterranean region. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its narrow, sword-shaped leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers that bloom in the summer months. Silphium wasiotense is notable for its medicinal properties, historically valued for its purported ability to treat various ailments. Due to overharvesting and habitat loss, it is now considered critically endangered.
